company: HSBC Service Delivery (Polska) Sp. z o.o.
about: We are seeking an experienced Delivery Manager to join us in our fast-paced Platform as a Service (PaaS) team within the Engineering Foundation Value Stream (VS). Engineering Foundation is an Enabler Value Stream that will enable and accelerate Wealth and Personal Banking (WPB) engineering teams to develop resilient and performant applications, delivering value to the business more easily and quickly. This will be achieved through a fully managed strategic and cost optimised Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) for developing and deploying applications to the cloud. Our goal is to help HSBC teams deliver cost-effective journeys securely. Our attention to detail needs to be excellent as should our ability to assess ‚Äòthe bigger picture‚Äô. You will be part of a cross functional team transforming our digital capabilities. Driving innovation, delivering products in ever shortening cycles and helping to drive the continuous improvement of our processes, tooling, and engineering practices. The Delivery Manager is a passionate, inspiring technologist who leads by example, champions‚Äô innovation and quality and knows how to deliver. They will be able to deliver accurate data and will be held accountable for the successful delivery of technology projects and ensuring benefits realisation. We are looking for an accomplished Delivery Manager to contribute to our goals.
duties: Facilitate the delivery of working software from concept to live using Agile methodologies as well as help align business goals with release plans to ensure timely delivery of features.
Foster collaboration among teams and protect the team from external influences or distractions.

Work alongside Product Owners, other Scrum Masters/Delivery Managers and closely with the Delivery Lead to enable and ensure the team has all they need to deliver on time, removing impediments as you go.
Facilitate the Scrum process by arranging and leading agile ceremonies, daily scrum, sprint planning, sprint review, refinement sessions, discovery sessions, sprint demo and retrospectives.
Plan and schedule the delivery increment while maintaining the teams‚Äô scrum board as well as challenge the team to improve on process and inspire them to find new better ways of working.
Help identify and mitigate delivery risks and dependencies.
Drive, track, and communicate the progress of sprints and releases through team velocity and burn down charts and other useful metrics.
You will be responsible for achieving targets and meeting expectations whilst supporting and encouraging others to do the same.
requirements: Strong practical experience and understanding of SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework)/Agile methodologies, Scrum and Kanban.
Proven track record of successfully delivering to key objectives and deliverables, on time, to scope and within budget.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills and proven experience managing global stakeholders and teams.
Experience in estimation techniques and planning for software development projects.
Experience in effectively collaborating with wider non-agile teams.
Stakeholder management with statistics around tasks, backlog tracking, and burn down metrics, velocity, and user stories etc.
Exposure and experience with the SDLC; design, coding, test, build, QA, deployment, and maintenance and with service orientated architecture.
Demonstrable ability to self-manage, be proactive, take ownership, build relationships, and drive solutions through from inception to production.
Professional experience with tools such as Confluence, Jira, Rally are highly beneficial.

offer_title: Senior Software QA Engineer - C# - Civil Engineering Software
about: Become a member and participate in forming several new Software Engineering Scrum teams joining the Civil Infrastructure Product Line Group in Krakow. Our team develops Civil engineering software, like Autodesk Civil 3D, to help civil engineers during both the design and construction process. We are looking for someone that is passionate and committed to working in an Agile team, has great attention to detail, skilled in the testing of desktop software APIs or scripting API using C#, and the ability to create and execute test strategies for the validation of complex software. You have a customer focus and the ability to drive quality in a predictable manner. In this role, you will have a significant impact on how we design, build, and deliver our products to millions of professionals. You will work in a cross-functional team focused on building and maintaining software for various products and components. You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of unique challenges which give you the chance to learn modern technology and grow your skills. Tech that we use C#, C++ 17, Node, Docker, Python, AWS, Artifactory, CMake, Jenkins

Develop test strategies that are complete and concise
Perform functional testing, regression testing, ongoing system integration, and periodic build verification tests as part of each product release cycle
Find defects in features in development or products in production. Isolate, confirm, and log defects, and work with Agile Team to prioritize and fix them
Actively participate in Agile ceremonies‚ÄØsuch as sprint planning, backlog grooming, sprint retrospective etc
Work with the Agile team at improving Quality Assurance processes and be an ambassador for quality
Identify redundant tests scenarios and work on their automation
requirements: Proficient in C# programming language
Working Experience or educational background in Civil Infrastructure industry
Passion to improve product quality
Customer orientated approach to Quality Assurance
Attention to detail
Some experience in software development in a commercial setting in a Scrum team
First or upper-second class degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field
Solid English knowledge

Experience with Git or similar source code revision control systems

about: Are you passionate about evolving and revolutionising HR technology? Join Groupon as our HRIS Integration Specialist to design, develop and test various types of Workday integrations. The role requires interaction with other internal (Finance, HR, IT and Payroll) and external team members, responding to requests and providing integrated solutions. We are looking for an energetic, highly analytical, and creative problem solver to join Groupon‚Äôs Human Resources Information Systems Team (HRIS). As the HRIS Integration Specialist you will support and maintain Workday Integrations and help support other Workday modules, contributing to a great employee and manager experience. You will be responsible for the overall gathering of system requirements and working with the business to ensure focus on providing solutions in their assigned functional areas of Workday to meet business needs. The new member will be responsible for configuration of Workday HCM solution, testing and troubleshooting.
duties: As a HRIS Integration Specialist, you will join our team to design, develop and test various types of Workday integrations
The role requires interaction with other internal (Finance, HR, IT and Payroll) and external team members, responding to requests and providing integrated solutions
We work in an agile, flexible approach to defining business requirements and deliverables
Develop and test integrations within the Workday architecture
Review and translate business specifications and change requests into requirements and technical specifications
Understand and follow defined integration/development standards and best practices
Leverage Agile framework principles and follow project methodologies
Understand and ensure data security, privacy and data quality in integrations is maintained
Design, develop, and maintain integrations using the latest Workday tools such as Workday Studio, EIB (Enterprise Interface Builder), Core Connectors, PICOF/PACOF, and Workday Integration Cloud.
Collaborate with internal teams and external vendors to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Create detailed technical design documents, ensuring adherence to best practices and Workday‚Äôs integration standards.
Manage and monitor integration performance, ensuring all processes run efficiently and troubleshooting any issues that arise.
Implement and support APIs (SOAP, REST) to integrate Workday with third-party applications.
Maintain data integrity, ensuring that data is accurately synced between Workday and other systems, including HCM, payroll, finance, and other associated modules.
Provide ongoing support and maintenance of existing integrations, addressing any updates or new requirements that arise.
Stay up-to-date with Workday‚Äôs latest release features and evaluate how they can be leveraged for improving integration processes.
Work closely with stakeholders to provide guidance on data mapping, transformation, and validation processes.
Perform unit testing, system integration testing, and support UAT (User Acceptance Testing) for all Workday integrations.
Utilize Workday‚Äôs latest tools for reporting and analytics to improve the visibility of integration performance and system health.
Ensure that all integration solutions are scalable, secure, and compliant with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.
requirements: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in relevant technical field (Information Technology, Computer Science, Software, Engineering, or related technical discipline) or equivalent combination of training and work experience
5 plus experience as Workday Integration Development
Proven experience with integrations: Have a deep understanding of how Workday connects to other business systems, and how to manage data flow, security, and synchronization
Proficiency in Workday Studio, EIBs, Core Connectors, Workday Web Services (WWS), and Workday Integration Cloud.
Strong knowledge of API integration technologies including SOAP and REST, as well as the latest Workday API updates.
Experience with XSLT, XML, JSON, and other data transformation tools.
Experience working with Workday Extend to customize integrations and build custom applications when needed.
Familiarity with Workday‚Äôs newest features such as Workday Prism Analytics, Workday Extend, and Workday Orchestrate.
Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex integration issues.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Knowledge of security standards in SaaS and cloud-based environments, particularly within Workday.
Experience in system integration testing, data validation, and error handling.
3+ years of experience with Workday functional configuration across three or more HCM modules such as Core HR, Compensation, Benefits Payroll, Absence and Time-Tracking is highly desirable.
3+ years of experience with cross-functional Workday administration including roles, permissions and security design and business process management.
2+ years of experience in HRIS project management including analysis, stakeholder engagement, and documentation. .
Proven experience handling confidential and sensitive information.
Ability to understand and react quickly to changing priorities
Compliance experience in PII, GDPR, SOX preferred.
Workday certification is a plus
Strong understanding of Workday modules especially Core HR, Recruiting, Time and Absence, Payroll, Business Processes, Organizational Hierarchies and Integrations Security
Experience working with Workday Payroll in-house and/or Workday solutions integrated with third party payroll providers. PECI/PICOF experience is preferred
Experience developing Workday integrations (EIB, Core Connectors, Advanced Custom Reports and Document Transforms) is mandatory
Experience in building integrations using Workday Web services and APIs (WSDL, SOAP, REST and WS standards)
Experience working in XML, XSLT, Workday Custom Reports and Workday Custom Objects, BIRT
Experience in automation tools and programming languages outside of Workday space (MS Power Apps, SQL, HTML)

about: Digital & Technology Team (D&T) is an integral division of HEINEKEN Global Shared Services Center. We are committed to making Heineken the most connected brewery. That includes digitalizing and integrating our processes, ensuring best-in-class technology, and embedding a data-driven culture. By joining us you will work in one of the most dynamic and innovative teams and have a direct impact on building the future of Heineken! Would you like to meet the Team, see our office and much more? Visit our website: Heineken (heineken-dt.pl). This role is part of the D&T department of HEINEKEN International and is located in Heineken Global Shared Service. D&T is proud to bring cutting-edge innovation, strong technology and advanced analytics to HEINEKEN. With speed and agility we ensure HEINEKEN has the technological competitive advantages it needs to deliver on its ambition. The Senior Data Quality Specialist role is critical in Heineken to operationalise our strategy to measure and improve data quality across the enterprise. We are looking for an experienced data quality professional to actively contribute to the implementation of services for data quality monitoring, reporting framework, and data quality lifecycle management. The role holder will work with colleagues across Heineken to implement, and mature, our approach to how data quality is measured and visualised. This will include facilitating our Design Reference Groups for DQ, engaging with colleagues from our operating companies and tracking of continuous improvement actions and progress. This role also includes managing DQ related projects & team members (external & internal). Success will require that the role holder own these processes and become an ambassador for co-creation and collaboration. A core goal of our data quality service is to provide operating companies with the insight they need to remediate data quality issues. Additionally, functions running strategic programmes require the ability to more accurately understand and plan for the work required to get data ready for change. The role holder will provide services to support these outcomes. The role holder will also work with colleagues from our business and subject matter experts to identify new and evolving data quality requirements needed to deliver targeting metrics. Maturing our DQ services will require that the role holder work collaboratively also with technology specialists to understand new functionality of the tools that we use and track implementation of enhancements.

liasing with business, functional owners & SMEs to be a point of contact for all DQ related topics

about: Are you passionate about identity management? Join our dynamic team as an IAM Analyst, where you`ll play a crucial role in safeguarding our organization`s digital assets. Your responsibilities will include developing IAM strategies, advising on service integration, and setting comprehensive guidelines and policies. Additionally, you`ll support merger and acquisition activities, monitor audit outcomes, and stay updated with the latest industry standards. If you have a keen eye for detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving, we want to hear from you.
duties: Help to make the organization ready for a 'Zero Trust' world by contributing to an integrated reference architecture picture for globally deployed strategic IAM platforms used by all business units and regions.
Build and continuously develop the IAM capability blueprint and best practices for Joiner/Mover/Leaver processes, authentication, authorization and access governance.
Provide consulting to application owners for IAM Service onboarding and integration.
Curate and create guidelines, standards and policies for the IAM environment in alignment with the IAM Service Organization and our Stakeholders, provide guidance to the IAM community.
Plan and scope activities for architecture implementation.
Support IAM aspects of M&A activities.
Track Audit activities and findings in the IAM area.
Keep up with industry trends and standards.
requirements: Graduate degree preferably in Information Security or Computer Science, CISSP certification or similar are warmly welcomed.
Experience with and strong understanding of components of the IAM landscape, such as Identity Management platforms, processes, authentication technologies, authorization approaches and capabilities.
Knowledge of IAM architecture principles and information security.
Experience with Cloud Security, specifically for Azure and/or SAP is a strong plus.
Good communicative skills - ability to promote and communicate IAM architecture and solutions in a Stakeholder targeted manner.
Ability to work independently in a matrix organization - pleasure in working with dynamic, international teams.
Fluent in English - both oral and written.

about: Elevate our IT transformation initiatives by enhancing our IT controlling capabilities and implementing robust Technology Business Management (TBM) practices. Drive financial transparency, optimize, manage and report on IT costs. Your engagement will be instrumental in setting up the Technology Business Management (TBM) framework, refining recharging mechanisms, and fostering a practice of financial discipline to support our organization's growth. As an early joiner, you will be able to strengthen the function within the IT organization.
duties: Reporting: Prepare, analyze and explain monthly and yearly internal reporting

Contribute to financial processes within the company.
Setup and advising: Implement robust financial reporting and KPI tracking for our IT organization, ensuring financial transparency and accountability.
Design and manage IT service recharge models to ensure precise cost allocation and recovery.
Identify and execute strategies for IT cost optimization and efficiency.
Lead the setup and integration of TBM practices across the organization, ensuring IT investments align with business value.
Develop comprehensive business case models to support IT project funding decisions and demonstrate value.
Implement and monitor IT cost control measures to maintain financial discipline and achieve budget targets.
Identify opportunities for improvement.
requirements: Master‚Äôs degree in finance or computer science, dual Master is strong plus.

Relevant certifications such as Certified Technology Business Management Executive (CTBME), Certified Technology Business Management Professional (CTBMP), or Certified IT Finance Manager (CITFM) are highly desirable.
Extensive experience in IT costing and financial project/program/portfolio management.
Proven track record in IT project and program control.
Expertise in IT service recharge modeling and IT benchmarks.
Deep understanding of Technology Business Management (TBM) and its application in aligning IT investments with business strategy.
Strong analytical skills and experience with IT investment analysis and ROI assessments.
Ability to operate with minimal supervision and take ownership of complex projects.
Strong communication skills, comfortable engaging with executive and C-level stakeholders.
Strategic thinker with a proactive approach to identifying opportunities for cost optimization and efficiency.
Experienced in working within a financially driven, international, private equity-backed organization.
Demonstrated ability to generate and present comprehensive financial reports for senior leadership.

offer_title: Independent Model Review Specialist, Model Risk Management
company: HSBC Service Delivery (Polska) Sp. z o.o.
about: Model Risk Management (MRM) at HSBC is structured as a global function, headed up by the Chief Model Risk Officer (CMRO). The MRM function reports directly to the Group Chief Risk and Compliance Officer (GCRCO) ensuring its independence from the model developing and owning areas of the firm. MRM are the second line of defence (2LoD) for Model Risk and the CMRO is the global Model Risk Steward for the group and is also accountable for the global operation of the MRM function. MRM teams are based in each region, to ensure local subject matter expertise and to guide, review, and challenge. MRM activity is managed on a global basis as many models are used in multiple locations. This enables MRM to operate consistently and efficiently globally, and to take account of additional local regulatory requirements. Independent Model Validation is a specialist quantitative role within the Model Risk Management team responsible for carrying out independent validations of HSBC‚Äôs model landscape, to identify and communicate model limitations and issues. This role is part of the Markets Front Office & Product Control validation team. Independent Model Validation provides independent challenge of a model‚Äôs underlying theoretical assumptions and limitations, its practical implementation, its live application, and business usage, providing stakeholders (including model users, senior management, audit and regulators) with assurance that models and tools developed, maintained and used within HSBC Group are fit for their intended purposes and are compliant with applicable internal and supervisory expectations. They will also review remediation plans and activities, undertake portfolio level reviews across model types and challenge the model owners on the appropriate application of relevant policy of models.
duties: Undertake model validation and testing activities as dictated by the Global Model Risk Policy including the assessment of; model inputs, calculations, reporting outputs, conceptual soundness of the underlying theory and the suitability of the use for its intended purpose, relevance and completeness of data, qualitative information and judgements, documentation, and implementation of the model.
Provide written reports detailing the results of validations highlighting issues identified during the validation.
Communicate technical model related information and results to Model Owners and Model Users through the course of a validation.
Contribute to management, regulatory, and external confidence in all models used across the group.
requirements: Master‚Äôs or PhD degree in a quantitative discipline like Financial Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Quantitative Finance, Economics or Engineering.
Knowledge in one or more of the following areas: Stress Testing and Scenario Analysis models, Traded Risk and Pricing Models, Global Markets Trading & Hedging models, Asset Liability Models, etc.
Knowledge of statistical model and scorecard development techniques.
Knowledge of Risk models, performance metrics and risks and associated issues.
Some knowledge of internal procedures and local regulations and those of other country regulators would be an advantage.
Experience with some statistical modelling software / programming language e.g. SAS, Python, R, Matlab, C++, VBA.
Experience of developing and reviewing models throughout the customer lifecycle.
Experience of conducting independent model reviews is beneficial.

offer_title: Lead Solution Architect - Data and AI
about: We are seeking a seasoned Solution Architect specializing in Data and AI to design and implement cutting-edge data platforms and AI-driven solutions. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including business stakeholders, data engineers, data scientists, and developers, to deliver scalable and robust architectures that address complex business challenges. *We are looking for Poland based candidate. The job is remote but may require some business trips. Ideal start date: early January 2025
duties: Design end-to-end architectures for data processing, storage, and analytics platforms.
Develop AI/ML deployment strategies aligned with business requirements.
Choose appropriate technologies (cloud, on-prem, hybrid) to support business goals.
Design and implement modern data pipelines for ETL/ELT processes.
Optimize data lakes, warehouses, and real-time streaming platforms (e.g., Azure Synapse, AWS Redshift, or Databricks).
Ensure data quality, lineage, and security with compliance standards (GDPR, CCPA, etc.).
Collaborate with data scientists to operationalize machine learning models.
Architect MLOps pipelines for model training, deployment, and monitoring.
Stay updated on advancements in AI and incorporate them into solution designs.
Gather and analyze business requirements to design tailored solutions.
Act as the technical point of contact for customers and internal teams.
Present architectural recommendations to stakeholders in clear, actionable terms.
Provide technical guidance on data engineering, AI/ML best practices, and DevOps methodologies.
Lead proof-of-concept (POC) initiatives for emerging technologies.
Mentor teams in implementing scalable, efficient solutions.
requirements: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.
8+ years in solution architecture, with a focus on data and AI/ML projects.
Proven expertise in cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud).
Experience with big data tools (Spark, Kafka, Hadoop) and analytics platforms (Power BI, Tableau).
Proficiency in programming languages (Python, Java, or Scala).
Hands-on experience with AI/ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Strong knowledge of data modeling, database design, and query optimization.
Strong problem-solving abilities and a strategic mindset.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

about: Are you a problem solver who really likes to dive into complex systems? Are you also good at creating good customer relations and you like working in a strong team? Consafe Logistics is now looking for Application Support Consultants to our Customer Service in Warsaw ‚Äì people who will ensure that our large global customers are working smoothly using our systems! ABOUT SERVICE DESK As an Application Support Consultant you will work closely with our customers to always provide them with high quality support and service 24/7. We are looking both for experienced support specialists as well as junior candidates with a problem-solving attitude, motivated to provide great customer experience. Depending on your experience, you can work on problems with different degrees of difficulty. At Consafe Logistics you will work in a culture characterized by diversity, innovation, and transparency. We work with large global customers whose challenge lies in streamlining their logistics flows. You will get the opportunity to get a deep understanding of warehouse management and grow professionally while solving more and more difficult problems. We believe in long term relationships, both with customers and employees.
duties: As an Application Support Consultant, you will investigate and solve our customers' incidents, investigate root cause and will be responsible for the actions taken and help our customers at the start of a project.

You will work with time-consuming issues that really make use of your ability to both look into the details and see the big picture, as well as creating good relationships and build trust with the customers.
You will contribute to the successful and efficient support process by providing adequate information for first, second and third line investigation and location of the problem.
requirements: High troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
Great communication skills.
Strong customer focus.
Good understanding of computer systems, mainly Windows and SQL.
Understanding of logistics, logistics equipment and case management systems.
Bachelor degree in IT, engineering or similar field.
Fluency in Polish and English.
Openness to shift work.
Availability to hybrid work (3 days weekly of office work and 2 days weekly of remote work, in case of daily shifts).

about: This role will provide the candidate an opportunity to manage the service transition of IT applications into operations mode, coordinating support engineering resources that manage application and data-related incidents, problems and change on a day-to-day basis for our new Commercial Risk Solutions Ecosystem.
duties: Working with Product Managers on the safe transition to operations of products/applications that make up our ecosystem.
Single point of escalation for Incidents, Problems and Change relating to the ecosystem, including but not limited to availability, performance, function, data correctness.
Manage and coordinate all support teams across a range of heterogenous applications covering full scope of Web, API, Database, ETL, 3rd party on-prem and SaaS.
Managing issues from inception through to resolution including triage, app/data patching, dispatch to L3+ product teams, communications and general reporting.
Liaising with engineering managers and product managers on issues and enhancements to ensure effective prioritisation and appropriate engineering standards.

requirements: 10+ years experience in ITIL Service Management, with at least 3 years management-level. ITIL or DataOps certification a distinct plus.

Agile knowledge and planning skills ‚Äì Kanban and Scrum. Certification highly desirable.
Experience in Agile tooling and solutions relating to code, branch and release management.
Azure (or AWS) cloud support experience desirable ‚Äì IaaS and PaaS including containerization and serverless
Some experience of Software Delivery LifeCycle (SDLC) across homegrown, low-code (e.g. Appian, Workato) and SaaS delivery models.
Advocate for and experience in automated testing.
Experience in commercial insurance industry a distinct plus.
College degree in IT-related discipline.

duties: Acting as a primary local company contact for assigned sites for specific trials. Trials may include both early and late-phase clinical trials.

BA/BS degree life science or equivalent.

about: We are looking for a Senior Python Developer to be a part of the DEVTALENTS team and contribute to the development of truly amazing solutions for businesses all over the world. Joining DEVTALENTS can be a life-changing decision for you, with endless benefits along the way. We provide top projects for which recruitment is not possible externally because of our wide range of partners. We value open and transparent communication, leveraging tools like Slack and generative AI to enhance collaboration and efficiency. We support continuous growth, encouraging you to step beyond your comfort zone and develop technically and personally. We are looking for an experienced Senior Python Developer to join our team and provide technical leadership and mentorship.
duties: Own end-to-end feature development, from architectural design to deployment, ensuring performance, scalability, and reliability.
Champion best practices in coding, testing, and DevOps, leveraging AWS, Terraform, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelines.
Mentor and guide mid-level and junior engineers through code reviews, knowledge sharing, and continuous feedback loops.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams‚Äîproduct managers, designers, and other engineers‚Äîto deliver robust, cloud-native solutions aligned with business goals.
Utilize analytics, user insights, and prompt engineering to continually improve processes, optimize code generation, and innovate around automated workflows.
Ensure adherence to security, compliance, and industry standards, while consistently striving to improve overall code quality and system resilience.
requirements: Expert-level proficiency in Python (6+ years of commercial experience) for backend development, scripting, and automation.

Mastery of Python features, data structures, and frameworks like Django, Flask, or FastAPI, as well as robust testing practices (pytest). Experience with Pandas, NumPy, or machine learning tools is a bonus.
Solid background in AWS EC2, Terraform, CloudFormation, and Kubernetes. Familiarity with other cloud providers (Azure) is a plus.
Experience integrating third-party APIs, working with both SQL and NoSQL databases, and setting up CI/CD pipelines. Prior work with SaaS platforms, microservices, or IoT systems is a plus.
Proficiency in Docker and Kubernetes. Experience scaling applications in microservices architectures is advantageous.
Expertise in configuring pipelines via Jenkins, GitHub Actions, or CircleCI for automated testing and deployment. Knowledge of advanced deployment strategies like blue/green or canary is a plus.
Ability to create and optimize prompts for AI-powered tools (e.g., GitHub Copilot) to enhance code generation efficiency. Familiarity with other AI-driven development tools and IDEs is welcome.
Strong understanding of unit testing, linting (PyLint), and security scanning (Snyk). Ability to implement error handling and maintain security compliance in enterprise systems is beneficial.

Understanding of microservice architectures, event-driven systems (Kafka), domain-driven design (DDD), and CQRS patterns. Experience with large-scale enterprise and cloud-native applications is a plus.

Expertise in designing and managing APIs (REST, gRPC, GraphQL) using frameworks like FastAPI, Flask, or Django. Experience with scalable GraphQL endpoints or real-time data integration is advantageous.
Higher education with a profile in Computer Science or related
English level min. B2.
Understanding of security best practices for Java applications and cloud environments.
Familiarity with authentication protocols (OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect, JWT).
Knowledge of API design (RESTful or GraphQL) and container orchestration tools (Kubernetes).

about: We are expanding our newly established software team in Krak√≥w, dedicated to developing robust ecosystem of "Service" applications for technicians who maintain electrical equipment in factories and their managers who plan and oversee their work. These applications will help track installation status, assess the condition of equipment, plan maintenance and perform safety operations. Our system aims to prevent blackouts and ensure machines remain operational. As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you will play a critical role in shaping and managing the Azure DevOps pipelines and releases that power our entire suite of Service applications. Your responsibilities will include overseeing the infrastructure, administrating Linux machines, and optimizing Azure resources, including Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters. You will also be responsible for creating and managing Helm charts to ensure consistent and efficient deployment processes. While your primary focus will be on the Azure environment, experience with Cyber Security topics and Terraform will be a valuable asset, further strengthening our commitment to security and infrastructure as code. We are looking for a proactive individual who is not just interested in running projects but in building and sustaining a robust, high-quality product ecosystem.

Ensure adherence to best practices in infrastructure management, focusing on security, scalability, and reliability. Knowledge of Cyber Security standards and best practices is a plus
requirements: University degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
5+ years of professional experience in DevOps, with a focus on Azure resources and cloud infrastructure
Strong expertise in managing Azure services, including PaaS, databases, storage, networks, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) and others
Proficiency in Azure DevOps, including Git repositories, CI/CD pipelines and release management. Knowledge of Terraform and IaaS concept is a plus
Solid experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes. Knowledge of Cyber Security and best practices is a plus
Hands-on experience in administering Linux machines and shell scripting in Bash/Python
Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills, strong written and spoken communication skills in English

about: We‚Äôre Markets & Securities Services IT Poland, a technology department providing technology services and solutions for the Investment Bank businesses at HSBC. Systems we create enable transactions across multiple asset classes. Our teams work in partnership with the business counterparts to deliver high-throughput systems, from low latency trading applications to large Microservices platforms. We also perform architecture and cloud migrations. eRisk are responsible for electronic pricing, trading, risk management and data analytics in Foreign Exchange. We are a team of around 70 people located in New York, Toronto, Hong Kong, Guangzhou, London and Krakow. Many functional applications are written in Java, we use various open-source solutions for tooling and there is a growing need to support other languages such as python and JavaScript. You will be part of a wider dedicated team of polyglot language developers who are responsible for delivering various research and production applications in Java, Python, KDB/Q, JavaScript. You will work in a pod split between Krakow and London heavily integrated with the various development teams and quantitative research analysts and traders.

about: We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join a renowned American apparel brand. In this role, you'll enhance consumer experiences by identifying improvement opportunities and prototyping solutions. You'll collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and engineers to develop and deploy ML models for e-commerce sites, in-store portals, and mobile apps, driving personalized consumer experiences. Project information:
duties: Implement end-to-end solutions for batch and real-time algorithms along with requisite tooling around monitoring, logging, automated testing, model retraining, model deployment and metadata tracking

Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for data analyses, model development, validation and implementation
Write efficient and scalable software to ship products in an iterative, continual-release environment
Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team and build cloud-native software for ML pipelines
Contribute to and re-use community best practices
Embody the values and passions with empathy to engage with colleagues from multiple backgrounds
requirements: University or advanced degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related field.
7+ years in software development, with strong experience in developing and deploying ML systems in large data science environments.
Proficient in Python, with tools like VSCode and Jupyter Notebooks; familiarity with Java, C++, or Scala is a plus.
Experienced with big data tools (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka) and cloud platforms, preferably GCP with serverless architecture.
Expertise in CI/CD processes using GitHub Actions, Harness, Jenkins.
Skilled in data warehousing (Google BigQuery) and independently managing Kubeflow pipelines.
Knowledgeable in feature engineering, feature stores, and audit processes.
Strong foundation in software engineering practices, including testing, CI, code reviews, and documentation.
Experience with ML orchestration systems (Kubeflow, Step Functions, ML Flow, Airflow, TFX) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
Strong reasoning to balance solution vs risk taking

about: We are looking for a Senior Pentester (Security Engineer) to be a part of the DEVTALENTS team and contribute to the development of truly amazing solutions for businesses all over the world. Joining DEVTALENTS can be a life-changing decision for you, with endless benefits along the way. We provide top projects for which recruitment is not possible externally because of our wide range of partners. We value open and transparent communication, leveraging tools like Slack and generative AI to enhance collaboration and efficiency. We support continuous growth, encouraging you to step beyond your comfort zone and develop technically and personally. We are looking for an experienced Senior Pentester (Security Engineer) to join our team and provide technical leadership and mentorship.
duties: Conduct in-depth penetration tests (white-box and black-box) on both internal and customer-facing applications, services, and infrastructure.
Oversee, prioritize, and analyze bug bounty submissions, as well as findings from external penetration tests.
Perform variant analysis on disclosed vulnerabilities across multiple platforms and frameworks.
Investigate and review third-party solutions to ensure they meet our security standards.
Create and refine tools for reconnaissance, process automation, and ongoing metrics and performance tracking.
Offer expert advice to engineering and security operations teams, providing clear remediation strategies and deeper insight into identified issues.
Promote offensive security principles by hosting demos, workshops, and training sessions, building a stronger security-minded culture.
Evaluate our technology stack through the most effective methods available, adapting your approach as the environment evolves.
Determine priorities and focus areas to maximize value and impact.
Contribute significantly to the ongoing development and maturity of our security program.
requirements: Proven track record in penetration testing, vulnerability assessment, and other technical security evaluations.
Strong ability to find, understand, and articulate security flaws in code, particularly in Java and Node.js environments.
Hands-on experience with cloud infrastructures, especially AWS, and familiarity with modern microservice-oriented architectures.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of clearly conveying findings and suggesting pragmatic, targeted improvements rather than merely reporting issues.
Comfortable scripting in Python and contributing to more extensive security tooling or automation projects.
Self-driven, with the initiative to spearhead projects that strengthen the broader security culture and foundations.
Hold one or more reputable industry certifications (e.g., OSCP, OSWE, CREST, GIAC, AWS certifications).
Active participant in CTFs and the broader cybersecurity community, staying current on emerging threats and best practices.
Higher education with a profile in Computer Science or related
English level min. B2.

about: The IT Compliance team is responsible for the compliance of the organisation's IT systems, networks and infrastructure in accordance with the IT industry best practices and standards. The IT Compliance Specialist will play a key role in identifying IT risks, enhancing IT processes, and recommending actionable improvements to close control gaps or boost efficiency. An important part of our role is to provide leaders and managers of the various departments in the organisation with guidance and knowledge on IT compliance risks and internal controls. Daily tasks are based on strong collaboration with other members of the organisation to develop and implement policies and procedures that will help the company achieve the expected level of maturity of its internal controls programme.
requirements: Have 2+ years of experience in IT compliance, IT internal controls, IT auditing, or related roles,
Possess professional knowledge of IT concepts such as logical access management, change management, DevOps, data management, and cybersecurity
Are familiar with Agile/Scrum/Kanban methodologies
Have practical knowledge and experience in maintaining compliance and managing audit programmes.
Are inquisitive, meaning that are able to effectively identify and assess the severity and potential impact of risks and communicate findings to area owners in Tech organisation
Have a mindset, approach and soft skills allowing to build strong relations with internal partners and driving projects in cooperation with related units
Have the ability to communicate with people at different levels of the organisation, influence and lead other teams through change with good relationships
Are highly organized, detail-oriented, and analytical problem-solvers
Are able to use data analysis systems (e.g. Data Studio) and produce clear and functional documentation, in such a way as to initiate the desired direction of change
Know English on at least B2 level and Polish on at least C1 level
Certifications such as CIA, PCIP, CISA, CISM or CISSP
Familiarity with IT frameworks and standards (ISO27001, NIST, PCI DSS, CCM, SAMM, ITIL, COBIT)
Practical working-knowledge of SQL

about: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced IT Sourcing Manager to join our team. The primary responsibility of this role is to develop and implement strategic sourcing initiatives for the IT and Technology category at Simon Kucher globally, ensuring the acquisition of high-quality IT Services, Software and Hardware at the best possible value. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of IT procurement processes, market trends, supplier management, and negotiation techniques.
duties: Develop and execute strategic sourcing strategies for the IT category to optimize cost savings, quality, and supplier performance.
Conduct market research and analysis to identify emerging trends, potential suppliers, and innovative solutions within the IT industry.

Lead supplier identification, evaluation, selection, and contract negotiation processes to secure favorable terms and conditions.
In partnership with IT leadership, manage supplier relationships and performance through regular reviews, KPI tracking, and performance improvement initiatives.
Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance Procurement processes, efficiency, and effectiveness within the IT category.
Ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements throughout the procurement lifecycle.
Monitor and mitigate risks associated with the IT supply chain, including geopolitical, financial, and operational risks.
Provide guidance and support to internal stakeholders on procurement best practices, supplier selection, and contract management.
requirements: Around seven years proven experience in IT procurement, strategic sourcing, and supplier management roles, preferably in a multinational organization.
Deep understanding of IT products and services, including hardware, software, cloud services, and telecommunications.
Knowledge of contract law, procurement regulations, and ethical sourcing practices.
Demonstrated track record of successfully managing complex procurement projects and driving cost savings initiatives.
Proficiency in procurement software, ERP systems, and Microsoft Office Suite.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data, conduct financial analysis, and make data-driven decisions.
Excellent Project Management, negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Proactive, results-oriented, and adaptable to change with a continuous improvement mindset.

about: As an Application Support Engineer, you will be responsible for resolving Application Support requests and incidents for a critical trading application used by a Top Tier Investment Banks. You will be working directly with Business and IT users, so must have strong client facing skills. You will follow the best practices to deliver quality in all aspects of Level 2 support. You will participate on an out of hours on-call support rota and performing occasional weekend work. Technical tasks include monitoring, detecting and troubleshooting issues in Linux application environments, responding to queries regarding application functionality, working with vendors on upgrades, preparing and testing software and configuration changes as well as some shell scripting to automate common tasks. As a team player, you will recommend ways to improve the supportability, availability, efficiency of the application, procedure and working practices.
duties: Resolving Application Support requests and incidents for a critical trading application

requirements: Strong client facing and communication skills

Practical knowledge of SQL

Ability to solve problems independently
Ability to work in a team environment
1st or 2nd Line of Support background and experience as an Application Support Engineer
General CI/CD (DevOps process) knowledge
Availability to work in shifts
Experience with Cloud (AWS)

offer_title: BlackRock Aladdin SME / Data Analyst (Aladdin Studio Integration)
about: Our Client is a global leader in financial services, providing a wide range of products and services to individual, corporate, and institutional clients. The role involves working with a variety of stakeholders, including developers, QA engineers, product managers, and business owners, to ensure that releases are delivered on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards. The Client‚Äôs Mission is to serve as a trusted partner to their clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. They have set expectations for how they must act to bring their mission to life. These expectations are at the heart of the Leadership Principles ‚Äì we take ownership, we deliver with pride and we succeed together. Maxima Consulting is an IT consulting company founded in 1993 in Boston. Our technology experts across North America, Europe, Asia, and Australia help organizations of all shapes and sizes in their digital transformation efforts. We provide practical and dependable solutions to the IT infrastructure, software development, quality assurance, maintenance & support, cybersecurity challenges, and a broad scope of additional services. Position Summary: We are looking for an experienced BlackRock Aladdin SME / Data Analyst with expertise in Aladdin Studio integration to drive data management, analysis, and system integration efforts within Citi Bank's asset management and portfolio operations. The ideal candidate will bring in-depth knowledge of the Aladdin platform, particularly in optimizing data flows and integrating Aladdin Studio with various business processes to ensure accurate and timely insights across our investment management operations.
duties: Act as the subject matter expert (SME) on the BlackRock Aladdin platform, providing guidance, training, and support across the business and technology teams.
Lead the design and implementation of Aladdin Studio integrations to ensure smooth data flow and process automation between Aladdin and Citi Bank‚Äôs internal systems.
Build and optimize custom workflows, reports, and dashboards using Aladdin Studio's analytical and programming capabilities.
Extract, transform, and analyze large datasets from Aladdin to support portfolio management, risk analysis, and compliance monitoring.

Configure and customize the Aladdin platform to meet Citi Bank‚Äôs business needs, including creating custom analytics, dashboards, and data pipelines. Ensure that all system configurations comply with best practices and regulatory requirements.
Work closely with portfolio managers, risk managers, IT teams, and data analysts to understand business needs and translate them into technical solutions within the Aladdin ecosystem.

Continuously improve Aladdin system performance by identifying opportunities to enhance workflows, automate processes, and streamline data integration efforts. Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues within the Aladdin platform.
Develop and maintain detailed technical documentation, including integration workflows, data mappings, and process guidelines.
Manage end-to-end projects related to Aladdin implementations and system enhancements.
Ensure the Aladdin platform and associated processes comply with regulatory requirements, and provide support for audits and regulatory reviews as needed.
requirements: 5+ years of experience working with the BlackRock Aladdin platform, with a strong focus on Aladdin Studio integration and data analytics.
Proven experience in financial services, particularly in asset management, portfolio management, or risk management functions.
Advanced proficiency with Aladdin Studio and its integration capabilities.
Strong experience in data analytics, particularly with SQL, Python, or similar programming languages for data manipulation and analysis.
Knowledge of API integration, ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, and data workflows.
Solid understanding of investment management, asset allocation, risk management, and regulatory compliance.
Familiarity with fixed income, equities, and derivatives trading and portfolio management processes.

about: Capacity management purpose: Bank has identified undesired non-financial risks outside risk appetite related to the ability of the bank to failover and run in the event of one data centre (DC) outage due to a physical event. Bank‚Äôs technical teams have identified technical limitations preventing the approved 2DC Mirroring architecture from working.2DC mirroring requires large amount of additional capacity from our Datacentres ‚Äì mainly Space, Power, Cooling. Currently Datacentres are at capacity and new capacity will not be available in the size 2DC Mirroring requires. Bank is running at capacity limit for committed capacity for our Data Centers but has 20-30% potentially free capacity that can be free up. To install the new hardware, old one needs to be decommissioned to free up the Power (kW). Decommissioning old hardware requires time-consuming migration of currently installed applications to the new hardware and needs to be monitored and escalated by capacity management. Exec summary: Business analytics persons is required to support BCCM capacity manager with: 1. demand planning, governance setup/improvements, workshops, 2. facilitate and execute on the short term capacity free up initiatives. 3. facilitate and execute on the long term capacity free up initiatives. Role Description: This role will support BCCM WS4 capacity management project‚Äôs activities to ensure that they are delivered in a timely and appropriate manner.
duties: Identify data sources for capacity forecast
Establish communication channels to coordinate capacity requests and delivery
Collect capacity requirements from BCCM workstreams
Analyze the data and prepare short and long term forecast
Plan and co-ordinate capacity free up initiatives
Manage, monitor and report on the progress capacity delivery and free up initiatives
Create Capacity plan overviews for discussion and approval from key stakeholders
Ensure
requirements: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to gather and interpret complex data and work in Excel

Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work

about: We seek a highly skilled and motivated DevOps engineers to join our growing Samsung Ads team in role of embedded Site Reliability Engineering (SRE). As SRE, you will lead development and buildout of components of Samsung‚Äôs DSP platform. As an embedded Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) you‚Äôll be part of a software development team and act as a subject matter expert on the challenges of usability, performance, reliability, scalability and observability. The ideal candidate has deep knowledge and a strong interest in process automation, observability, software-defined infrastructure, and approaches it from the perspective of a software engineer. Challenges of globally distributed services, deciding what and when state should be shared, and simulating failure scenarios should drive you. Samsung Ads is a highly successful and fast-growing business for over last six years. This business and its continued future success depend on the products, technologies, and tools owned by Samsung. Hundreds of people strong, with a substantial presence in five countries, Samsung Ads team is a dynamic and complex organization operating across a broad spectrum of product and strategic domains. Join our team and play a key role in shaping the future of our ad tech platform. Technologies in use:

about: Sportradar is the leading global provider of sports data and entertainment products and services. Since 2001, we have occupied a unique position at the intersection of the sports, media and betting industries; providing sports federations, news media, consumer platforms and sports betting operators with a range of solutions to help grow their business. The Information Security group provides services to ensure confidentiality, integrity and availability of information and systems owned by Sportradar and its subsidiaries. The Product Security unit within Information Security works primary with the Engineering group to ensure that the products & services developed by its Tribes are Secure-by-Design and remain Secure-in-Production. This includes coaching developers on secure development practices, building products for our cloud environment that help developers prevent vulnerabilities and misconfigurations arising over time, and managing the attack surface so that engineers can focus their remediation efforts on the highest criticality vulnerabilities specific to Sportradar‚Äôs risk profile. We also run an external Bug-Bounty programme for in-scope applications, as well as a Security Champions community across Sportradar.
duties: Respond to identified vulnerabilities in our applications and cloud environments without jeopardizing product roadmap.
Evangelize and coach engineers on secure design & development practices through threat modelling and help remediate findings through pair-programming sessions.
Cross pollination of secure development techniques and best practices across engineering tribes.
Collaborate across both SSD and ASM teams in Product Security to ensure unit initiatives are successfully delivered.
Be on-hand to assist colleagues as part of our incident response process should this be required.
requirements: You get excited by challenges, and have a positive, can-do attitude in working with different teams, locations and technologies to achieve the best outcome.
You are interested in cloud and application security and thrive on having multiple problems to solve, together with a continuous learning mindset.
You enjoy diving in and figuring the crux of a problem quickly and helping provide a pragmatic solution to the team, whilst efficiently communicating the outcome to techies and managers alike.
You are comfortable with mentoring others and taking a lead role for an initiative to help deliver the intended outcomes.
Degree in software development, or other relevant experience.
10+ years of experience as a software developer or DevOps professional.
Ability to manage, prioritize, remediate vulnerabilities like those on the OWASP Top10 list.
Excellent knowledge in at least one of the object-orientated programming languages like Java, .NET, and scripting languages like Python, JavaScript, etc.
Experience with AWS cloud services, especially their security products.
Experience with modern technologies like Kubernetes, Protobuf, gRPC, and GraphQL.
Experience with automated deployments and containerized application management.
Experience with message brokers (e.g. Kafka), and relational databases (e.g. MySQL.
A keen interest in continuous professional learning across software engineering, cloud, and application security domains.
Working in agile development teams in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent inter-personal and communication skills with fluency in English (written & spoken).
Ability to take a lead role in the team, supervising and/or mentoring others.
Cloud-native development and/or experience with other public & hybrid cloud services (GCP, OCI, etc).
Hands-on experience with Cloud & Software Security and DevSecOps tooling such as CNAPP, SAST and SCA.
Experience with maintaining large-scale and fault-tolerant distributed systems in production.
Experience with test-driven development.

about: We're Markets & Securities Services IT Poland, a technology department providing technology services and solutions for the Investment Bank businesses at HSBC. Systems we create enable transactions across multiple asset classes. Our teams work in partnership with the business counterparts to deliver high-throughput systems, from low latency trading applications to large Microservices platforms. We also perform architecture and cloud migrations. Finance IT is a specialist team dedicated to independent review of Front Office and Risk models and Profit and Loss analysis. Supports Product Control in the design and implementation of software to enhance the control framework used by Product Control and Market Risk Management. As Software Engineer you will work closely with technical leads and developers in Poland, United Kingdom, India and China.  The team is engaged in the definition, development and implementation of Product Control's strategic analysis and reporting systems.

about: We are looking for a Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Architect to join Digital Hub Warsaw! Join Our Team as a Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Architect! Are you a visionary leader with a passion for shaping marketing technology strategies? As the Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Architect, you will be the cornerstone of our marketing automation team, guiding a group of talented developers and ensuring the successful implementation of innovative solutions. If you are ready to take on a leadership role and drive impactful marketing initiatives, we want to hear from you!
duties: Solution Architecture Leadership: Design and oversee the implementation of comprehensive end-to-end solutions within Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC), aligning marketing strategies with technological capabilities to enhance customer engagement.
Data Architecture Expertise: Lead the design of complex data models and segmentation strategies, ensuring optimal use of Data Extensions and Subscriber Models to support targeted marketing efforts.
API & Integration Oversight: Spearhead the integration of SFMC with Salesforce CRM and other platforms using REST and SOAP APIs, ensuring seamless data synchronization and enhanced customer journeys.
Team Development and Guidance: Mentor and develop a team of Marketing Cloud Developers, fostering a collaborative environment that encourages innovation and professional growth.
Cross-Channel Orchestration: Guide the team in creating cohesive customer experiences by aligning email, SMS, push, and social marketing channels to drive unified engagement.

Performance Optimization Strategies: Establish best practices for A/B testing, deliverability optimization, and campaign performance analysis, ensuring the team consistently delivers high-impact results.
Stakeholder Management: Collaborate with key stakeholders to gather business requirements, communicate architectural solutions, and manage expectations throughout project lifecycles.

Compliance and Security Leadership: Ensure adherence to data privacy regulations (GDPR, CCPA) and marketing compliance standards (CAN-SPAM, CASL), establishing protocols for data handling and user permissions.
requirements: You have extensive experience in Salesforce Marketing Cloud, with a strong focus on solution architecture and integration capabilities within the Salesforce ecosystem.
Deep understanding of SFMC modules like Email Studio, Contact Builder, Automation Studio, and Journey Builder.
Experience in integrating external data sources in Snowflake.
Good understanding of Salesforce product portfolio like Data Cloud and Health Cloud.
Familiarity with SQL, AMPscript, SSJS, HTML and CSS, especially for Emails.
You hold relevant certifications, such as Salesforce Marketing Cloud Architect or System Architect, and are committed to continuous learning in the rapidly evolving SFMC landscape.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (Computer Science, Marketing, or similar).

offer_title: Data Integration Developer (ETL, RESTful API, CI/CD)
duties: ETL Development and Maintenance:
Design, develop, and maintain ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into target systems.
Optimize ETL workflows to enhance performance and data accuracy.
Monitor and troubleshoot ETL jobs to ensure successful data processing.
System Integration:
Develop and implement system integration solutions to ensure seamless data flow between disparate systems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify integration requirements and design integration solutions.
Maintain and enhance integration platforms and middleware to support business needs.
RESTful API Development:
Design, develop, and maintain RESTful APIs to facilitate data exchange between systems.
Ensure APIs are secure, scalable, and well-documented.
Implement API testing and monitoring to ensure reliability and performance.
CI/CD Implementation:
Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate the build, test, and deployment processes.
Ensure integration and ETL solutions are continuously delivered with high quality.
Collaborate with DevOps teams to optimize deployment workflows and toolchains.
Data Management:
Ensure data quality, integrity, and consistency across systems.
Develop and enforce data governance policies and procedures.
Implement data validation and cleansing techniques to improve data reliability.
Support and Troubleshooting:
Provide support for data integration, ETL, API, and CI/CD issues, ensuring timely resolution.
Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective actions to prevent recurrence.
requirements: Proven experience in ETL development, system integration, RESTful API development, and CI/CD implementation.
Hands-on experience with ETL tools such as Informatica, Talend, or SSIS.
Experience with integration platforms and middleware technologies (e.g., MuleSoft, Dell Boomi).
Familiarity with data modeling, SQL, and database management systems.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Attention to detail and a commitment to quality.

about: Are you an innovative thinker with a passion for driving business performance into the future? We are looking for a Senior Supply Chain Business Analyst reporting to the Supply Chain Performance Manager to join our Global Excellence team. In this role, you will play a global role and leverage data, AI, and advanced analytics to enhance our supply chain strategy, drive efficiency, and empower data-driven decision-making. Join our Huntsman Advanced Materials division and bring your expertise in AI-driven analytics to make a substantial impact on our business performance. This role requires a unique combination of technical expertise and business acumen. We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Supply Chain Business Analyst in this newly created position.
duties: Executive Reporting: Create real-time, interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI to provide strategic insights, enabling stakeholders to make informed decisions.
AI-Driven Use Cases: Design and implement AI and machine learning models for supply chain optimization in areas like planning, inventory management, and risk mitigation.
Advanced Analytics & Scenario Planning: Utilize machine learning and advanced analytics for scenario planning, enhancing supply chain efficiency and optimizing inventory and cost structures.

Develop and Monitor KPIs: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics for our supply chain organization. Continuously assess and refine metrics based on feedback and evolving business needs.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with stakeholders to implement new processes and data-driven practices, ensuring alignment with company standards and promoting best practices across teams.
requirements: Bachelor's degree in business Analytics, Data Science, Supply Chain Management, or equivalent experience. A master's degree is preferred.
3-5+ years in business analytics or a similar role, with a focus on supply chain or operations.

Data Analysis & Visualization: Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Power BI and Azure Synapse Analytics for creating dashboards and visualizations. Knowledge of DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) for complex data manipulation is a plus.
Machine Learning & AI: Proficient in Azure Machine Learning (Azure ML) and Python for developing and deploying predictive models.
Data Engineering & ETL: Proficient in Azure Data Factory, SQL databases, and Azure Databricks for managing and transforming data pipelines.
Strong understanding of business operations and the ability to leverage data insights to meet business objectives.
Proven ability to manage projects, facilitate change, and deliver results in dynamic environments.
Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across functions and effectively communicate insights to a multicultural audience.
Familiarity with MRP tools and SAP is a plus.
Ability to collaborate with cross regional departments.

about: Join our dynamic co.brick Observe team, where you'll have the opportunity to help develop an innovative AI-driven platform. We are combining data monitoring, anomaly detection, predictive analytics, and user support powered by Generative AI. You‚Äôll also contribute to AI/ML Proof of Concepts (PoCs) and MVP projects, utilizing cutting-edge technologies in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. This is an exciting opportunity to shape the future of AI-powered user interactions and make a real impact. If you thrive in a startup-like atmosphere and are passionate about driving innovation, we‚Äôd love to have you on board!
duties: Design and implement scalable backend services in Python that support, ML and generative AI solutions, for knowledge inference and user support, including developing conversational React agents capable of understanding and responding in natural language.
Develop and maintain semantic knowledge bases using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) processes to enhance the system's ability to provide accurate, contextually relevant information and support.
Continuously improve data inference models to enable better predictions, and automated recommendations, contributing to smarter system functionalities.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the seamless integration of generative AI and semantic knowledge solutions into the broader system (such as Observe as a complex observability system), improving overall performance and user experience.
Development of AI/ML Proof of Concepts (PoCs) and Minimum Viable Products (MVPs), showcasing innovative solutions and demonstrating the potential of new technologies in real-world applications.
Provide ongoing support, ensuring alignment with the latest AI-driven methodologies and tools.
Stay informed about emerging AI technologies, trends, and best practices. Apply this knowledge to improve data engineering processes and techniques continuously.
requirements: Experience with asynchronous programming in Python (asyncio, aiofiles, aiohttp)
Experience with REST API frameworks (FastAPI)
Solid programming skills in Python, familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git), knowledge of various database systems and data warehousing concepts (e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB)
Hands-on experience in generative AI/NLP solutions and Machine Learning model development and deployment.
Familiarity with semantic knowledge bases and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) processes, along with experience in integrating AI solutions for knowledge inference and support systems.
Expertise in data inference models and developing automated recommendation systems, with a focus on optimizing predictions and enhancing system intelligence.
Experience working in cross-functional teams, collaborating with data scientists and engineers to ensure smooth integration of AI solutions into complex systems.
Strong knowledge of conversational AI agents, including the development and optimization of personalized natural language-based support systems.
Nice to have: Experience with agentic architecture for GenAI applications (AutoGen, Langraph)

Proficiency with LLM-specific models, prompt engineering, libraries, and frameworks, such as Hugging Face, LlamaCloud, or LLMs APIs (eg. OpenAI API), and experience fine-tuning large language models for specialized tasks.
Experience with MLOps tools relevant to generative AI, such as LangChain, LlamaIndex, for managing pipelines, prompt engineering, and scaling LLM deployments.

Strong understanding of retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems, with experience in building and managing semantic knowledge bases that leverage AI for organizing, retrieving, and maintaining data-driven insights.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and excellent communication and teamwork abilities to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

Experience and knowledge of AI/ML models for anomaly detection, prediction, and similar tasks in observability systems is a plus, with the ability to leverage these models to enhance system reliability and proactively resolve issues.
Experience with prototyping frameworks such as Streamlit is also a plus, to enable rapid development and deployment of user interfaces for prototype applications and functionalities.
Experience in IoT or industrial sector is a nice to have.

about: We are looking for a .Net Full-Stack Developer to build Middleware APIs and Integration Solutions for one of the leaders in the global Hospitality Industry. This role is fully remote, and you will be part of an international team. The ideal candidate should be available to work from 9:00 to 18:00 or 10:00 to 19:00 (including a one-hour break). As part of this role, you'll need to coordinate with team members worldwide during certain times. We work with .Net 8.1 and use MySQL and SQL Server as our databases. While knowledge of databases is beneficial, deep expertise is not required since the current work involves minimal interaction with databases, and surface knowledge is sufficient. The Middleware team is responsible for building and maintaining various middleware solutions, including Loyalty/CRM, Exports, Inventory, Ordering, Delivery and Reservations/TMS. Initially, you will focus on one middleware, but you may transition between different projects based on the team‚Äôs needs. Our development process includes frameworks for unit testing via Postman API calls. Developers are expected to test their code using these frameworks or extend them when necessary to ensure quality. The role involves both new development and maintenance/support of existing solutions. If you are looking to join a dynamic, global team and contribute to innovative middleware solutions, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!
duties: Collaborate with Internal teams and Communicate with External customers
Write, Test and Deploy Applications to Public or Private clouds
Revise, Update, debug and refactor code
Support Internal and External customers
Be available for rotating Escalation in off hours
Follow specifications to build new Integrations
requirements: Minimum 3 - 5 years of professional experience as a C# .NET developer
Proficiency with ASP.NET Core or later
Ability to architect applications using frameworks and APIs
Ability to work both independently and in teams
Experience with building Web APIs
Experience with utilizing cloud storage in .Net Core applications
Desired: Experience with AWS / Azure clouds, VMs, Docker, AWS ECS
Technical skills - combination of: C#, Web APIs, SQL, LINQ, Javascript/HTML/CSS, AJAX, JQuery,
React/Angular/Vue
